It depends on the hill. I’ve seen pros actually walk their bikes up the Koppenberg in the Tour of Flanders. It’s up to a 22% grade in some points, and cobbled. And narrow. So cram a peloton of riders and a horde of spectators on that path along with an exhausted rider, and you might see the best of the best forced to dismount. If anyone can cycle up a grade that steep at more than single-digit speeds, I don’t know who it would be. There are other climbs that are nearly as steep and are much longer (the Ventoux in the French Alps, for example). No one is going to set any land speed records up an ascent like that.
